revised_title: Electricity and the Ignition of Fustian Cloth
tldr: A father reports an unexpected experiment where his son, who suffers from sudden fits, was electrified and caused his fustian frock to catch fire. The father, Robert Roche, shares this observation with the Royal Society, expressing his surprise as previous literature stated only substances emitting inflammable vapors could catch fire due to electricity. This account raises questions about the understanding of electricity and its effects on different materials.
